com.percussion.loader.extractor
Class PSVariableEvaluator

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.loader.extractor.PSVariableEvaluator

public class PSVariableEvaluator
extends Object

This class is used to evaluate an extractor variable against its current context. The VAR_XXX is a list of pre-defined extractor variables.

Field Summary

          The content of the source file or URL.
static String VAR_CURRENT_DATETIME
          The mime-type of the source file or URL.

          The name and extension of the source file or URL, which does not include the parent directories.

          The path of the source file or URL.

          The size (in bytes) of the source file or URL.

Field Detail

VAR_CONTENT

public static final String VAR_CONTENT
The content of the source file or URL. It is binary content for binary extractors, but is text / character content for text extractors

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final String VAR_FILEEXTENSION
The file extension of the source file or URL.

public static final String VAR_FILENAME
The name of the source file or URL, which does not include file extension and the parent directories

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VAR_FILENAME_EXTENSION

public static final String VAR_FILENAME_EXTENSION
The name and extension of the source file or URL, which does not include the parent directories.

VAR_FILEPATH

public static final String VAR_FILEPATH
The path of the source file or URL. It is relative to the search root.

Constructor Detail

PSVariableEvaluator

public PSVariableEvaluator(PSItemContext itemCtx,
                           boolean isBinaryContent,
                           InputStream in)
Constructs this object from a set of parameters as the current context. The encoding of the current JVM will be used to convert bytes to text if it is not set by calling setEncoding(String).

Parameters:
itemCtx - The data source context, it may not be null.
isBinaryContent - true if the content of the data source is binary.
in - The stream that can be used to get the source data. The caller of this method is responsible to close this stream, but not the method itself. It may be null.
Method Detail

setEncoding

public void setEncoding(String encoding)
Set the encoding that is used to convert byte content to text. This will only effect text content, has no effect for binary content.

Parameters:
encoding - The specified encoding, may not be null.

evaluate

public IPSFieldValue evaluate(String expression)
                       throws IOException
Evaluates the specified expression against current source data of this object.

Parameters:
expression - The to be evaluated expression. It may be one of the VAR_XXX or a string constant. It may be empty or null.
Returns:
The evaluated field value, never null.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - source data is null and expression is VAR_CONENT.
IOException - if error occurs while retrieving source data.

getAllowedVariables

public static String[] getAllowedVariables()
Returns an array of all allowed variables

Returns:
array of variables, Never null.
